result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Terry

defendant.name: Terry, Michael Anthony

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Anthony Terry in court.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for Michael Anthony Terry.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is waiting on additional discovery. Court sets 10/21/22 as the deadline for the State to turn over affidavit and any additional discovery. Court sets 10/31/22 as the deadline for defense to file any motions. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Terry in court.  Attorney Michael Moran for Michael Levine in court for Michael Anthony Terry.  Prosecuting attorney Jon Josephsen Jr. for Patrick Frankin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Anthony Terry in court with Attorney Michael Moran for Attorney Michael G. Levine.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Request for Substitution of Judge Van Grunsven filed by Defense. Discussion held.  Court consented to substitution.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brittany Grayson, Br. 16.  

Matter adjourned to Br. 16 for Arraignment hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Reservation of Right to File Property Return Petition, filed.
Request for Substitution of Judge, by Attorney Michael Levine for defendant, filed.

Defendant Michael Anthony Terry in court with Attorney Michael Moran on behalf of Attorney Michael G. Levine.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Defense requests an arraignment date. 
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to Branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Arraignment scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Michael Anthony Terry in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
